definition: to have a look
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

sentences.english: Liu often encourages foreigners to visit Shenzhen at sports meetings.
sentences.chinese: 比赛时，刘虹都会邀请外国运动员到深圳看一看。
欢迎到华星店亲自看一看。

sentences.english: And we would need, to have to look at it, and it's going to be very tricky, by the way, as to what the right answer is.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要去看一看，顺便说下，正确答案可能很棘手。

sentences.english: Dog: ohh, it smellssooooo delicious dowm here. I must go and have a look.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到的是什么？闻起来相当好闻，我必须去看一看。

sentences.english: What do you want to see in SFO ?
sentences.chinese: 你们在旧金山想看一看什么？

sentences.english: Today, Han Jia and I will bring you to Linzhou to take a look at the Grand Taihang Canyon.
sentences.chinese: 今天我和韩佳就要带你去林州的太行大峡谷看一看。

sentences.english: Oliver: Let's have a look at the natural history section.
sentences.chinese: 接下来，让我们去看一看博物馆里的动植物学展区。

sentences.english: Hey, a pet shop. Let's go in and have a look.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，宠物商店，我们进去看一看吧。

sentences.english: He looked into the shop on the way.
sentences.chinese: 在路上他顺便进商店看一看。

sentences.english: A: Hey Ted, I saw this ad in the paper. You should take a look.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，特德，我看到报纸上的这篇广告，你该看一看。

sentences.english: Naturally she also longs to see faraway places.
sentences.chinese: 自然她也渴望去看一看远处的地方。

sentences.english: Take the liberty to write you this letter of recommendation, please your taking the time to look at.
sentences.chinese: 冒昧给您写这封建议书，请您在百忙中抽空看一看。

sentences.english: We'll go to the estate agency tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 到我们房产公司看一看照片和规划。

sentences.english: I'v always wanted to see Ayers Rock.
sentences.chinese: 我总是想看一看艾尔斯岩。

sentences.english: I'm going to refer you to an allergist.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你去看一看过敏症专家。

definition: to take a look at/to examine/to survey/(coll.) pretty soon
to say sth
to stroll
to have a try
there is no harm in/might as well
to check out/to investigate
(used after a verb) give it a go/to do (sth for a bit to give it a try)/one time/once/in a while/all of a sudden/all at once
to discuss/to have a chat
to roam around/to have a stroll
(onom.) smack!
(modal particle indicating suggestion or surmise)/...right?/...OK?/...I presume.
bar (loanword) (serving drinks, or providing Internet access etc)/to puff (on a pipe etc)/(onom.) bang/abbr. for 貼吧|贴吧[tie1 ba1]
to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
to have time (to do sth)
we or us (including both the speaker and the person(s) spoken to)/(dialect) I or me/(dialect) (in a coaxing or familiar way) you/also pr. [za2 men5]
(before a noun) Do (you, they etc) have ...?/Is there a ...?/(before a verb) Did (you, they etc) (verb, infinitive)?/Have (you, they etc) (verb, past participle)?
conveniently/in passing/without much extra effort
to give it a try
